ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We learned a lot of practical knowledge about how to direct scenes/plays. We covered a lot -- we talked about process and outlined one option of what a director's process can look like.

I developed the ability to effectively communicate the vision for a play after analyzing it in its entirety with the goal of staging. In this class you will practice effective communication with actors and designers.
I learned how to read plays and write materials in a helpful way for directing.  This was also kind of like a Director's Roundtable so I learned a lot from my classmates.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was great -- I think it's possible that making it a full-year course would allow people to get even more out of it.

I loved how much discussion was in this class and how it allowed the students to get their concerns addressed and questions about their particular interest. There's a lot of hands on work directing involved in this class. I think one of the most difficult part about it is that projects often require people to come and work with you for really little return which can be limiting.

This course was amazing.  I learned so much from Dr. Stokes speaking from her experiences directing and just doing multiple projects over the semester.  I feel like sometimes class time could be used for rehearsals, or class could be canceled to allow time to do other coursework before I did rehearsals outside of class could have been helpful.  The organization of this course was a little off, but Dr. Stokes originally wasn't planning to teach this course and also got COVID for a bit so it was great for what she could do.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! We learned a lot of practical knowledge, which can sometimes be hard to come by. Lots of concrete things on how to frame your rehearsal schedule, how to work with actors, exercises you can use, questions you can ask, etc. It was really helpful

I definitely recommend this to any student that has any interest in doing a collaborative artistic production in the future. This course helps you to better understand the work that is required to lead a creative project and methods and techniques that are helpful to effectively communicate how to pull a project together. While this class is focused specifically on theater I believe that it can be useful in any creative context.

I 100% would if you're interested in directing and developing your directing skills in a low-pressure environment.  In extracurricular theater, there feels like high pressure to produce something good, while here, it was focused on learning.  After taking this class, I feel more confident in directing and calling myself a Director.

extras.title: THST 300 01 - The Director and the Text I
